CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To gain a better understanding of the nonlinear compositional dependence of the J SC and PCE values of the PBDTT- DPP - TPD random terpolymers , the molecular geometries and the electron density distribution were simulated using density functional theory ( DFT ) at the B3LYP / 6-31G(d,p) level with the Spartan 08 software package.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers |

In this paragraph, there is only one material mentioned, which is the "PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers |

In this paragraph, only the "PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers" are clearly referred to as a material. Other entities such as "molecular geometries", "electron density distribution", "density functional theory (DFT)", "B3LYP / 6-31G(d,p)", and "Spartan 08 software package" are methods or tools used to study the material, not the material itself.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To gain a better understanding of the nonlinear compositional dependence of the J SC and PCE values of the PBDTT- DPP - TPD random terpolymers , the molecular geometries and the electron density distribution were simulated using density functional theory ( DFT ) at the B3LYP / 6-31G(d,p) level with the Spartan 08 software package.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J SC values of the PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers |
| PCE values of the PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers |
| Molecular geometries of the PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers |
| Electron density distribution of the PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers |
| Level of DFT calculations (B3LYP) |
| Software package used for simulations (Spartan 08)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J SC values |
| PCE values |
| Electron density distribution |

These are the entities in the paragraph that can be considered as material properties or values. The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to material properties.

- To gain a better understanding of the nonlinear compositional dependence of the J SC and PCE values
- of the PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers,
- the molecular geometries and the electron density distribution
- were simulated using density functional theory ( DFT )
- at the B3LYP / 6-31G(d,p) level
- with the Spartan 08 software package.

J SC and PCE are material properties that refer to the current density-voltage characteristics of a solar cell. The electron density distribution is also a material property that describes the distribution of electrons within a material. The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to material properties, but rather to the methods used to obtain the material properties.
